intro: Conyza buxifolia, commonly known as false boxwood, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a leathery texture. Conyza buxifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
